docs.snippet: A strong undertone prevailed for the British pound sterling and Canadian dollar in the foreign exchange market during the past week. Business transacted was reported as only moderate in volume.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 24 -- The United States is airlifting arms to Nicaragua and Honduras, the State Department announced today.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 24 -- The United States is airlifting arms to Nicaragua and Honduras, the State Department announced today.
docs.abstract: US airlifts small arms to Honduras and Nicaragua as result of Communist shipment to Guatemala; Moscow radio charges US prepares attack on Guatemala

headline.main: U. S. FLYING ARMS TO 2 LATIN LANDS NEAR GUATEMALA; Nicaragua and Honduras Get Small Weapons as Result of Neighbor's Deal With Reds U. S. Planes Carry Small Arms To 2 Neighbors of Guatemala

docs.abstract: Govts refusal to accept IBRD credits in own currencies reptd barring nations from loans they need; demand for dollar loans cited

headline.main: MONEY CURBS CUT EUROPE'S PROFITS; Nondollar Loan Limits Bar World Bank From Helping Countries Eager to Buy

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., May 27 -- Thailand's United Nations delegate said today his country had decided to ask the Security Council to help guard against a spread of the Indochinese war.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., May 27 -- Thailand's United Nations delegate said today his country had decided to ask the Security Council to help guard against a spread of the Indochinese war.
docs.abstract: Kohman says Thailand will ask UN to send observers to bar spread of war; confs with Security Council members; indicates timing of appeal presents problem; Waithayakon says no final decision has been reached; Reston repts Dulles and Lodge conf on issue; says US, despite Brit opposition, agrees to back Thai move

headline.main: THAILAND DECIDES ON APPEAL TO U. N.; Will Bid Security Council Help Bar Spread of Indochinese War -- U. S. to Back Move THAILAND DECIDES ON APPEAL TO U. N.

byline.original: By A. M. ROSENTHALSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Two aspects of the defense of Southeast Asia are coming sharply into the news at the same time. They are the familiar pair, the political and the military. They overlap and interlock. Each move in either field is influenced by what is proposed,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Two aspects of the defense of Southeast Asia are coming sharply into the news at the same time. They are the familiar pair, the political and the military. They overlap and interlock. Each move in either field is influenced by what is proposed, possible or done in the other.

docs.snippet: ASUNCION, Paraguay, May 17 -- As far as Paraguay is concerned, Rutherford B. Hayes was one of the greatest Presidents the United States ever elected. As for Argentina, the memory of him still haunts President Juan Peron.
docs.lead_paragraph: ASUNCION, Paraguay, May 17 -- As far as Paraguay is concerned, Rutherford B. Hayes was one of the greatest Presidents the United States ever elected. As for Argentina, the memory of him still haunts President Juan Peron.
docs.abstract: continuing US prestige still linked to popularity of US Pres Hayes, who, as arbitrator in Triple Alliance War, made favorable award to Paraguay in 1878; other sources of goodwill for US noted; Pres Peron attempts to turn country to Argentina revd

headline.main: PRESTIGE OF U. S. HIGH IN PARAGUAY; Memory of President Hayes' Award in 1878 Is Strong -- Cultural Center Active

byline.original: By EDWARD A. MORROWSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: A slightly easier trend for the British pound sterling and a continuing strong undertone for the Canadian dollar marked the trading in the foreign exchange market during the past week. Volume of business transacted was reported as fairly large,...
docs.lead_paragraph: A slightly easier trend for the British pound sterling and a continuing strong undertone for the Canadian dollar marked the trading in the foreign exchange market during the past week. Volume of business transacted was reported as fairly large, especially as compared with that of the past few weeks.
